div.p: Coat colour phenology, snow cover and degree days at the Gardiner study site, MT (17/9/2010 to 9/7/2012), with autumn seasons on the left and spring seasons on the right . ( a) Weekly average of observed coat colour of 51 hares (2010 (red), 2011 (black) and 2012 (blue)). Dotted lines show the results of Bayesian change point analyses, giving the 95% credible intervals for the mean dates of initiation and completion of the colour moult for each season each year. ( b) Weekly average of observed snow cover in a 10-m radius around each hare. ( c) Degree days as a measure of cooling trend in the autumn and warming trend in the spring.
